definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
room/work unit/grave/scabbard/family or clan/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy

sentences.english: In the basement where Yang is living, there are many aisles leading to different rooms.
sentences.chinese: 在杨生活的这个地下室，有很多通道通往各个房间。

sentences.english: And while we’re talking about chores, the light in the basement burned out.
sentences.chinese: 既然在谈家务事，地下室的灯泡烧坏了。

sentences.english: Dust coated the furniture in my basement.
sentences.chinese: 我家地下室的家具盖满了灰尘。

sentences.english: They've never stored their memories in some old shoebox in the basement.
sentences.chinese: 他们从来不将记忆存在地下室的旧鞋盒里。

sentences.english: The solid rampart surrounded by moats boast as a iron-case with slab basements and bricks walls.
sentences.chinese: 天堑固垒并被吹嘘为铁案板坯地下室墙壁和砖头。

sentences.english: There, in the castle's basement, Evazan began his experiments again.
sentences.chinese: 在城堡的地下室，埃瓦赞再次开始他的实验。

sentences.english: Kim is left in the basement with the dead bodies.
sentences.chinese: 金姆被留在地下室，和那两具父女的尸体一起。

sentences.english: People would have laughed at me… a cellar rat selling real estate.
sentences.chinese: 大伙儿会笑话我的，一只住地下室的耗子卖房地产。

sentences.english: This building is about three floors, plus the ground floor, making it four floors.
sentences.chinese: 这栋建筑大约三层楼高，加上地下室总共四层。

sentences.english: A vast bulk of coal is still stored in the basement.
sentences.chinese: 地下室中仍储有大量的煤堆。

sentences.english: He found an original drawing of Picasso's in the basement of his father's house.
sentences.chinese: 他在父亲房屋的地下室里找到了一幅毕加索的真迹。
案发地点就在她家的地下室里。

sentences.english: A week ago, Tyler was pacing out the dimensions of the basement of the rented house on Paper Street.
sentences.chinese: 一个礼拜之前，泰勒在纸街大宅的地下室里来回踱步。

sentences.english: They transformed the basement into a reading room.
sentences.chinese: 他们把地下室改建成阅览室。

sentences.english: Most of the bodies were found in the basement of the two-storey building.
sentences.chinese: 大多数尸体是在这栋两层建筑的地下室被发现的。

sentences.english: The stairs leading to the basement are very slippery.
sentences.chinese: 通往地下室的楼梯很滑。

definition: top floor/attic/loft/garret/penthouse/(flat) rooftop (often used as an outdoor living area etc)
a room for keeping sth hidden/secret room/hidden chamber
building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
